text.more:
They show that there are 8 major groups that coauthor frequently within their own groups. The inter-group coauthorship is not uncommon, however relatively scarce compared to the numbers of that of intra-group. Larger group tends to have prominent figures who collaborate with a lot more people than other members of the group.

[Tools I used]
The visualization was made with Gephi 0.9.1
Exported to Sigma.js by plugin by InteractiveVis project
http://blogs.oii.ox.ac.uk/vis/
https://github.com/oxfordinternetinstitute/InteractiveVis/
text.intro:
Coauthorship network of scientists working on network theory and experiment, as compiled by M. Newman in May 2006.
As a part of programming assignment 2, Data Visualization by University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

Each node represents a network scientist.
Each edge represents coauthorship between two scientists.
The size of nodes represent the number of edges connected to them.
Scientists were grouped by the frequency of their coauthorships, represented in each column along the radial graphs.
Only the major groups are coloured.

Click below for more information
text.title: Coauthorship network of scientists working on network theory and experiment
